definitions.text: an inclination of the top half of the body forward and downward
small porch or set of steps at the front entrance of a house
bend one's back forward from the waist on down
examples: The young man stooped to pick up the girl's purse

definitions.text: debase oneself morally, act in an undignified, unworthy, or dishonorable way
examples: I won't stoop to reading other people's mail

definitions.text: descend swiftly, as if on prey
examples: The eagle stooped on the mice in the field

definitions.text: sag, bend, bend over or down
examples: the rocks stooped down over the hiking path

definitions.text: carry oneself, often habitually, with head, shoulders, and upper back bent forward
examples: The old man was stooping but he could walk around without a cane
